obr
Class AtomicRule

java.lang.Object
  obr.AtomConjunction
      obr.AtomicRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Atom>
public class AtomicRule
extends AtomConjunction

Represents an atomic rule.
A rule is an atom conjunction which adds the notions of "body" and "head".
An atomic rule contains only one atom in its head. The structure of this class is the same as a classical atom conjunction but its head pointer.

See Also:
AtomConjunction

frontier

public java.util.ArrayList<moca.graphs.vertices.Vertex<java.lang.Object>> frontier()
Creates a new array list containing all vertices which belong to the frontier of the rule. A term is said to be in the frontier iff it belongs to the body and to the head of the rule.

Returns:
An array list of Vertex<Object> which contains all terms in the frontier.

domain

public moca.graphs.vertices.VertexCollection<java.lang.Object> domain()

isFrontier

public boolean isFrontier(moca.graphs.vertices.Vertex<java.lang.Object> v)
                   throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
Allows to know if a vertex belongs to the frontier of a rule. A term is said to be in the frontier iff it belongs to the body and to the head of the rule.

Returns:
True if the vertex is in the frontier, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the vertex is null, or its id does not match to the rule, or it is an atom vertex.

isExistential

public boolean isExistential(moca.graphs.vertices.Vertex<java.lang.Object> v)
Checks if a vertex is an existential variable. An existential variable is a variable which appears only in the head of the rule.

Parameters:
v - The vertex to be checked.
Returns:
True if the vertex is an existential variable, false otherwise.

isUniversal

public boolean isUniversal(moca.graphs.vertices.Vertex<java.lang.Object> v)
Checks if a vertex is a universal variable. A universal variable is a variable which appears at least in the body of the rule.

Parameters:
v - The vertex to be checked.
Returns:
True if the vertex is a universal variable, false otherwise.

existentialIndex

public int[] existentialIndex()
Creates an array containing all positions of existential variables.
The length of the array matches the number of existential variables. This method is used by the unification process.

Returns:
An array of int containing the positions of all existential variables in the rule.

mayImply

public boolean mayImply(AtomicRule R)
Allows to know if the rule may imply the other one passed as parameter. I.e., if there exist a unificator between this rule head a subset of the other rule body.

Parameters:
R - The rule to be checked against.
Returns:
True if this rule may imply R, false otherwise.
See Also:
existUnification(AtomConjunction,AtomicRule)

existUnification

public static boolean existUnification(AtomConjunction H1,
                                       AtomicRule R)
Static method used to know if there exists a unification between the atom conjunction and the rule passed as parameters.

Parameters:
H1 - The atom conjonction to be unified.
R - The rule whose head will be unified.
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise.

extension

protected static AtomConjunction extension(AtomConjunction H1,
                                           int atomRootID,
                                           boolean[] isLocallyUnifiable,
                                           int[] E)
                                    throws ExtensionFailureException
Extends an atom conjunction for the unification algorithm.
This methods returns the atom conjunction corresponding to a minimal good unification set rooted in the atom ID from the complete atom conjunction H1.

Parameters:
H1 - The complete atom conjunction.
atomRootID - The id of the atom which will be the root of the returned atom conjunction.
isLocallyUnifiable - An array of booleans such as isLocallyUnifiable[i] = true iff atom i is still known as a locally unifiable one.
E - An array containing all existential positions of the rule whose head will be checked against the returned atom conjunction.
Returns:
A minimal good unification set rooted in a specific atom.
Throws:
ExtensionFailureException - If there exists no good unification set rooted in atomID from H1.

localUnification

protected static boolean localUnification(AtomConjunction H1,
                                          AtomicRule R,
                                          int[] existentialIndex)
Checks if there is a unification between the head of the rule and the full atom conjunction passed as parameters.

Parameters:
H1 - The atom conjunction to be unified.
R - The rule whose head is to be unified.
existentialIndex - The position of all existential variables of R. This parameter is here for optimization only.
Returns:
True if there exists a unification, false otherwise.
